title: Quantum Computing Concepts
description: Master the fundamental principles and advanced concepts of quantum computing through structured learning modules.

items.title: Quantum Mechanics Basics
items.description: Understanding quantum computing starts with grasping the fundamental principles of quantum mechanics that make quantum computation possible.

concepts.title: Wave-Particle Duality
concepts.description: Learn how quantum objects exhibit both wave and particle properties, forming the foundation of quantum behavior.

concepts.title: Uncertainty Principle
concepts.description: Explore Heisenberg's uncertainty principle and its implications for quantum information processing.

concepts.title: Quantum States
concepts.description: Understand how quantum systems are described by state vectors in complex vector spaces.

concepts.title: Probability Amplitudes
concepts.description: Discover how quantum probabilities arise from complex amplitudes and Born's rule.

items.title: Qubits & Superposition
items.description: The quantum bit (qubit) is the fundamental unit of quantum information, capable of existing in superposition states.

concepts.title: Bloch Sphere
concepts.description: Visualize qubit states using the Bloch sphere representation and understand geometric interpretations.

concepts.title: Superposition States
concepts.description: Learn how qubits can exist in combinations of |0‚ü© and |1‚ü© states simultaneously.

concepts.title: Quantum Interference
concepts.description: Explore how quantum amplitudes can interfere constructively or destructively.

concepts.title: Multi-Qubit Systems
concepts.description: Understand how multiple qubits create exponentially larger state spaces.

items.title: Quantum Entanglement
items.description: Quantum entanglement creates correlations between qubits that have no classical analogue, enabling powerful quantum algorithms.

concepts.title: Bell States
concepts.description: Study the four maximally entangled two-qubit states that form the foundation of quantum protocols.

concepts.title: Non-locality
concepts.description: Understand how entangled particles exhibit correlations that violate local realism.

concepts.title: Quantum Teleportation
concepts.description: Learn how quantum states can be transmitted using entanglement and classical communication.

concepts.title: Entanglement Measures
concepts.description: Explore mathematical tools to quantify and characterize entanglement in quantum systems.

items.title: Quantum Measurement
items.description: Quantum measurement is a fundamental process that extracts classical information from quantum systems.

concepts.title: Projective Measurements
concepts.description: Understand how measurements project quantum states onto orthogonal subspaces.

concepts.title: POVM Measurements
concepts.description: Learn about generalized measurements using Positive Operator-Valued Measures.

concepts.title: Measurement Statistics
concepts.description: Explore how quantum probabilities determine measurement outcomes and their statistics.

concepts.title: Weak Measurements
concepts.description: Discover how weak measurements can extract information without fully collapsing quantum states.

items.title: Single-Qubit Gates
items.description: Single-qubit gates are the fundamental building blocks for quantum computation, manipulating individual qubits.

concepts.title: Pauli Gates (X, Y, Z)
concepts.description: Learn the three Pauli gates and their geometric interpretations on the Bloch sphere.

concepts.title: Hadamard Gate
concepts.description: Understand how the Hadamard gate creates superposition states from computational basis states.

concepts.title: Phase Gates (S, T)
concepts.description: Explore phase gates that add relative phases without changing probability amplitudes.

concepts.title: Rotation Gates
concepts.description: Master arbitrary single-qubit rotations around different axes of the Bloch sphere.

items.title: Multi-Qubit Gates
items.description: Multi-qubit gates enable entanglement and complex quantum operations across multiple qubits.

concepts.title: CNOT Gate
concepts.description: The controlled-NOT gate is fundamental for creating entanglement and quantum logic.

concepts.title: Controlled Gates
concepts.description: Learn how to construct controlled versions of any single-qubit gate.

concepts.title: Toffoli Gate
concepts.description: Explore the three-qubit Toffoli gate and its role in reversible computation.

concepts.title: Fredkin Gate
concepts.description: Understand the controlled-SWAP gate and its applications in quantum algorithms.

items.title: Deutsch Algorithm
items.description: The Deutsch algorithm demonstrates quantum advantage for determining if a function is constant or balanced.

concepts.title: Oracle Construction
concepts.description: Learn how to construct quantum oracles for boolean functions.

concepts.title: Quantum Parallelism
concepts.description: Understand how quantum superposition enables parallel function evaluation.

items.title: Grover's Search
items.description: Grover's algorithm provides quadratic speedup for searching unsorted databases.

concepts.title: Amplitude Amplification
concepts.description: Master the core technique of selectively amplifying desired quantum amplitudes.

concepts.title: Optimal Search Time
concepts.description: Understand why Grover's algorithm achieves optimal search complexity.

items.title: Error Correction
items.description: Quantum error correction protects quantum information from decoherence and operational errors.

concepts.title: Stabilizer Codes
concepts.description: Learn the mathematical framework of stabilizer codes for quantum error correction.

concepts.title: Surface Codes
concepts.description: Explore topological quantum error correction using surface codes.
